content.content: Hi Dear Community, This post comes from all the articles, tweets, and other content generated around Dai collateralization in which the wrong graphic is used to describe the thing. What do you think if we take out that graphic from the front page?

I wouldn’t remove it. As much as it’s not a good look if you are concerned about stablecoin backing %, it is probably the most relevant thing to DAI holders as it does indicate what’s backing the DAI supply. Excess ETH/WBTC beyond 100% is not owned by the protocol and thus not part of redeem-ability. Maybe some more thorough explanations will help.

This. I’d actually love to expand that whole graph into its own page - including layperson’s explanations of what each of the backing tokens represent, and display of the historic backing. It is indeed the most relevant thing to any DAI Holder, and is a fantastic example of the level of transparency Maker can provide.

It is a fools errand at this point to explain the same thing over and over because ppl and media uses this in a mean and not honest way. Im suggesting to getting it off the front page, maybe as @LongForWisdom is saying, having its own page not in the front with proper explanation is far better.

MarianoDP:  It is a fools errand at this point to explain the same thing over and over because ppl and media uses this in a mean and not honest way.   Some people and media will always do that. It’s not a good argument to make information less accessible to those who would benefit from seeing it. I agree it’s a fools errand to keep explaining it, and that’s why it should be more prominent, on it’s own dedicated URL: whatbacksmydai.com or something. Such a page can clearly explain the benefits and drawbacks of DAI being partially backed by centralized stablecoins, and can be a marketing and growth tool. “Your stablecoin isn’t backed by centralized stablecoins, eh? Well then, what is it backed by, and how can users see that on a real-time basis? Cause you can see Maker’s here, we have nothing to hide.”
It is good to use that same weapon against them, they play with ignorance, we play with knowledge. I think it’s good to create a section of that graph.

Hey Mariano, thanks for the feedback. What stats do you think should be shown on the front page? I have been intending to overhaul this page for sometime as getting the historical Total Dai is the main item that makes loading daistats quite slow. A more detailed chart like the one that was shown on backeddai.makerdao.network on a separate page is a great idea, will look into it.

Long, I agree with you but who is going to build that? My proposal was to put it somewhere else because it is far easier to do that than to build something from the scratch in a DAO that has many balls in the air right now

MarianoDP:  My proposal was to put it somewhere else because it is far easier to do that than to build something from the scratch in a DAO that has many balls in the air right now   Yep, my argument against putting it somewhere else is that it makes it harder to find for the average user, and won’t prevent access to it for entities with an anti-maker agenda.
